item.title: Sunken patches, 17th June
item.description:
There are 2 sunken patches of tarmac which are now very deep and making cars swerve. They are outside numbers 17 & 39. Please could you repair these sunken patches?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, All Saints' Road, Fairview, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Residents need further detailed info on forthcoming works, 17th June
item.description:
The village of Shipton has been advised of resurfacing works in the village from Tuesday 24th June 2025 until Friday 4th July 2025 but requires further details, for example: 1. will the whole area be closed off for the 9 days or will this be done in stages? 2. If the latter, what is the schedule/sequence? 3. Where are residents in the affected areas to park during the works? 4. How will residents in the affected areas gain access to their properties during the works? (some residents have properties only accessible via the main road. They have no access via a pavement or via alternative routes to their premises). 5. What will happen about the school bus services? How will children be collected if the school bus is unable to get through the village. 6. What will happen if vehicles are left in the affected areas? (for example by a visitor who has no sight of the works) 7. What will happen about private deliveries being attempted to residents' premises? Residents are very keen to work with the Highways department to minimize disruption and delays to the works and this can be best supported by providing better details in advance. Regards Parish Councillor Andy Gibbs -07552 283345 andy.gibbs@shipton-village.uk
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shipton, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed

item.title: One way sign faded and needs replaced, 17th June
item.description:
The one way sign opposite the exit from The Royal is faded and needs replaced. It cannot be seen easily and there have been reports of cars turning right into oncoming traffic. There wasn't a sub-category for faded sign do I had to use this sub-category instead.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gladstone Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Sign structurally damaged/leaning more than 20 degrees/loose in ground (Non illuminating sign)

item.title: The drain is blocked problem, 17th June
item.description:
Customer reports that the drive has collapsed (this is the fourth time); they believe that the sand underneath has been undermined by water flow/run-off from the Highway which has entered the drain on their drive and flooded it (a builder has had to reinforce the drain's wall with concrete). STW have logged this, but do not have a category/are inferring it is not their issue. The customer asks if there are any site plans available for drainage in the location and requests that an officer contact them and arrange a site inspection with them in attendance.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Footpath is overgrown with grass/nettles and weeds. Crossing point, with textured paving for visually impaired is 90 per cent covered with soil and foliage. Extremely difficult to see cars speeding round the corner. The footpath has been marked up with spray paint saying 300m but that was several weeks ago and nothing has been done. This is the path used by many to take children to school and car drivers are unable to see them crossing the road until the last minute., 17th June

item.title: Bad damage to pavement, 17th June
item.description:
The pavement outside 3 Dark Lane is in an appalling state of disrepair, with multiple deep potholes, constituting a serious trip hazard, as well as being very unsightly. This problem has been there for 10+ years and has been reported before, but nothing ever gets done.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dark Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles problem, 17th June
item.description:
Customer reports that works in the location were completed recently, but the signs (marked "Core Highways" on the reverse) remain in place. These are being frequently kicked over and they are concerned that it is only a matter of time before they end up in the road. Please can they be collected asap.
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles
